description: Number of (2,n)-partitions of a chain of length n^3.
comments: a (k,n)-partition of a chain C is a chain of k intervals of C of length n.
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: a(2)=15 because in the linearly ordered set {1,..,8} we can choose in 15 ways 2 successive blocks of 2 consecutive elements.
author: Paolo Dominici (pl.dm(AT)libero.it), Jun 07 2000
